intro: Brassica stricta, commonly known as the upright mustard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with slender, erect stems and pinnately lobed leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces small, round seeds in a dry, three-lobed pod. Brassica stricta is often found in disturbed soils and can be an invasive species in certain regions.
